snippet.title: Retail spending up 0.3pct in June
snippet.content: Retail spending rose 0.3 per cent in June, beating market expectations of a modest 0.2 per cent rise. Seasonally adjusted retail spending totalled $26.15 billion in the month, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics. Household goods retailing rose 0.9 per cent, clothing, footwear & personal accessory sales rose 0.8, while department store sales were down 0.3 per cent.
